descr: "A booking of a healthcare event among patient(s), practitioner(s), related person(s) and/or device(s) for a specific date/time. This may result in one or more Encounter(s)."

fields.name: resourceType
fields.descr: "This is a Appointment resource"

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "This records identifiers associated with this appointment concern that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation)."

fields.name: status
fields.descr: "The overall status of the Appointment. Each of the participants has their own participation status which indicates their involvement in the process, however this status indicates the shared status."

fields.name: serviceCategory
fields.descr: "A broad categorisation of the service that is to be performed during this appointment."

fields.name: serviceType
fields.descr: "The specific service that is to be performed during this appointment."

fields.name: specialty
fields.descr: "The specialty of a practitioner that would be required to perform the service requested in this appointment."

fields.name: appointmentType
fields.descr: "The style of appointment or patient that has been booked in the slot (not service type)."

fields.name: reason
fields.descr: "The reason that this appointment is being scheduled. This is more clinical than administrative."

fields.name: indication
fields.descr: "Reason the appointment has been scheduled to take place, as specified using information from another resource. When the patient arrives and the encounter begins it may be used as the admission diagnosis. The indication will typically be a Condition (with other resources referenced in the evidence.detail), or a Procedure."

fields.name: priority
fields.descr: "The priority of the appointment. Can be used to make informed decisions if needing to re-prioritize appointments. (The iCal Standard specifies 0 as undefined, 1 as highest, 9 as lowest priority)."

fields.name: description
fields.descr: "The brief description of the appointment as would be shown on a subject line in a meeting request, or appointment list. Detailed or expanded information should be put in the comment field."

fields.name: supportingInformation
fields.descr: "Additional information to support the appointment provided when making the appointment."

fields.name: start
fields.descr: "Date/Time that the appointment is to take place."

fields.name: end
fields.descr: "Date/Time that the appointment is to conclude."

fields.name: minutesDuration
fields.descr: "Number of minutes that the appointment is to take. This can be less than the duration between the start and end times (where actual time of appointment is only an estimate or is a planned appointment request)."

fields.name: slot
fields.descr: "The slots from the participants' schedules that will be filled by the appointment."

fields.name: created
fields.descr: "The date that this appointment was initially created. This could be different to the meta.lastModified value on the initial entry, as this could have been before the resource was created on the FHIR server, and should remain unchanged over the lifespan of the appointment."

fields.name: comment
fields.descr: "Additional comments about the appointment."

fields.name: incomingReferral
fields.descr: "The referral request this appointment is allocated to assess (incoming referral)."

fields.name: participant
fields.descr: "List of participants involved in the appointment."

fields.name: requestedPeriod
fields.descr: "A set of date ranges (potentially including times) that the appointment is preferred to be scheduled within. When using these values, the minutes duration should be provided to indicate the length of the appointment to fill and populate the start/end times for the actual allocated time."

fields.name: text
fields.descr:
"A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it \"clinically safe\" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: contained
fields.descr:
"These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: extension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: modifierExtension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: id
fields.descr:
"The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: meta
fields.descr:
"The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: implicitRules
fields.descr:
"A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: language
fields.descr:
"The base language in which the resource is written."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource
